hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Stress Flip on Volume Spike & Support Break
hypothesis_content.statement: A NEUTRAL regime will transition rapidly to a STRESS regime if price breaks below a key recent consolidation support level (e.g., prior 2-week low) on a volume spike, where the breakout day's volume is > 150% of its 20-day average.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are defined by equilibrium and low conviction. A high-volume breakdown from a defined range shatters this equilibrium, indicating the emergence of strong, one-sided selling pressure and panic, which is the hallmark of a STRESS regime. This signal aims to front-run the regime model's confirmation.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks below and closes under the prior 14-day low
Breakdown day volume > 150% of 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime model confirms transition to STRESS
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims the broken support level (prior 14-day low) and closes above it within 2 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: High-volume breakdowns from NEUTRAL regimes fail to lead to a STRESS regime classification more than 35% of the time, instead reverting back into the range or transitioning only to a mild BEAR regime.
